source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_041_chunk1
evidence_span: growth specimens with various fabrication parameters were irradiated in a pressurized water reactor (PWR) to high fluences

extra_properties.irradiation_growth: increased with increasing yield strength at 300°C
extra_properties.grain_size_effect: growth depends on grain size especially below 2μm at 330-350°C
extra_properties.carbon_content_effect: growth depends on carbon content at 330-350°C
extra_properties.dislocation_formation: c-component dislocation loops form at ≥9×10²¹ cm⁻²

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_041_chunk1
evidence_span: Recrystallized material, which has a low yield strength, exhibits an increased growth rate at very high fluences

extra_properties.recovery_behavior: early growth recoverable, later accelerated growth not recoverable

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_041_chunk1
evidence_span: At temperatures in the range of 330 to 350°C, the growth depends on the grain size, especially below 2μm

extra_properties.yield_strength_effect: less pronounced than at 300°C due to irradiation-induced recovery

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_041_chunk1
evidence_span: TEM showed that an irradiation-induced formation of dislocations with a c-component occurs at neutron fluences ≥9×10²¹ cm⁻²

extra_properties.lower_fluence_effects: dislocation loops or fine precipitates or both
